thread.title: A quarter of Americans say God influences outcomes of sport
thread.title_full: A quarter of Americans say God influences outcomes of sport

title: A quarter of Americans say God influences outcomes of sport
text:
A quarter of Americans say God influences outcomes of sport Last updated 09:19, February 6 2017 KIRBY LEE 
Will divine intervention play a role in the Superbowl match between the Atlanta Falcons and New England Patriots? 
Countless Americans are spending their day praying God is a New England Patriots fan. 
The Patriots are taking on the Atlanta Falcons in this year's Superbowl, and - as research from PRRI.org reveals - up to a quarter of the crowd could believe God is influencing the game's outcome. 
The research reveals that 25 per cent of Americans believe God plays a role in determining the outcome of sporting events. WINSLOW TOWNSON 
New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady could have God on his side, a quarter of Americans believe. 
On the other hand, nearly three quarters of the public disagree with that statement. 
READ MORE: 
Just under half of Americans believe God at least rewards those who have faith, with good health and success coming to those who believe. 
Americans' views about God's role in sports differs according to religious background too, the research found. 
The research states that white evangelical protestants, as well as non-white protestants, are more likely to see divine intervention in a sporting event's outcome than any other religious group. 
Four in ten non-white Protestants, and 36 per cent white evangelical Protestants believe God plays a role in determining who wins various games. 
The research also delved into the Superbowl's popularity in the US - almost half of those surveyed said they were likely to watch the Patriots v Falcons match. 
It also showed youth football - referred to in the US as soccer - is overtaking little league baseball in terms of popularity. 
The Public Religion Research Insitute is a non-partisan, independent research group in the USA. - Stuff
